Reviews.Title: “Great value by Termini train station”
Reviews.Author: pamamia
Reviews.Content: For the price, It is a great place to stay. It might be basic, but very clean and comfortable for sleeping. As a tourist, who is going to stay in the hotel all day while in Rome? So close to Termini is definitely another plus.

Reviews.Title: “Rimini Hotel, Rome”
Reviews.Author: ShilpiDas
Reviews.Content: Nice small hotel bang opposite Termini Station. Lots of food joints nearby and 2 mins walk to the metro station through the Termini. The room was clean and simple. It looks a little old and tired though. The bathroom is tiny and pretty hard to move around. The room lacks basic amenities like a tea/coffe kettle etc. Having said that, the staff were very helpful and chatty. They gave some nice tips to stay safe and get decent food too. Breakfast although simple was nice. Good selection and spread. A lick of fresh paint and some nice upholstery can really spice up the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Good Honest Budget Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Wilkdz
Reviews.Content: Let's face it, you do not come to this place expecting luxury, For the price this a very decent hotel. Location is very good for walking to most of the main tourist attractions, although if you are looking for something close to the "action" then you may want to reconsider staying here.... Areas like Campo De Fiori will suit you better. For us we found the location to be perfect, off a side street opposite Termini Station so not too noisy. As a nice evening meal, i agree with other reviewers, you should definitely give Donati a go which is about 30 steps on your right from the hotel entrance. The room itself was very dated but suited our needs just fine, there was a bed which could be slept in (albeit slightly hard), there was a wardrobe which worked to store our clothes in (albeit it falling apart), there were plug sockets for us to use (even if they were hanging off the wall a bit). The huge mirror in front of the dresser worked as a mirror, even if it was fixed to the wall at a ridiculous angle.... My point is that if you pay peanuts what do you expect? Everything worked just fine but was by no means luxury. I emailed the hotel before we arrived and requested a room with a terrace, we were lucky enough to recieve this. Turned out to be a great move as the terrace was as big as the room, so in good weather (which we had) it gives you an extra living space. The hotel staff were all very friendly and extremely helpful, they cannot do enough for you. Previous reviewers commented on the breakfast, I would agree, pretty poor, we gave up after the first morning, and just grabbed coffee (ask the waitress to make it as the coffee they leave out is terrible) and some croissants and ate them on our terrace.

Reviews.Title: “spot on”
Reviews.Author: sue m
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights in February, room was very clean, comfortable & quiet, breakfasts were fab, plenty of choice, staff were lovely especially the helpful man on reception. The lift (small but in character with the rest of the hotel) did break down but was fixed the same day. Bathroom small but adequate. My only gripe is there is no tea/coffee making facilities. Would definitely recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Blue”
Reviews.Author: Jaywanne
Reviews.Content: This hotel was so close to the termini was quiet easy access to everything...

Reviews.Title: “comfy beds!! thats all !!”
Reviews.Author: Michaela H
Reviews.Content: thats the only positive ! emailed them specifically because this was booked for my partners 40th, requstes were ignored.. Breakfast..go early, we went at 9am ..nothing left, not a good morning nothing, no effort to replenish the food...heating went off and we were told it was being fixed, it wasnt !!! e were frozen !1 room we had was basic with a shoe box bathroom (603) had requested nice room, but didnt get, basically u get what u pay for, it was cheapish..but wouldnt go back, staff were abrupt, but the beds were comfy and we slept well..rome on the other hand was amazing !!!

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel.”
Reviews.Author: bandbwilltravel
Reviews.Content: Located in a side street opposite the train station and bus terminus which was also where the Terravision bus drops and picks up from both of Romes airports. The train station was a good place to eat with lots of different cafe/restaurants, most very reasonable. Thirty minutes walk to Colosseum and Trevi fountain in opposite direction. Reception and dining room staff all very friendly and helpful. Buffet breakfast available from 7-10am, plentiful and good selection of hot and cold foods and drinks. Hotel nice and warm and spotlessly clean. Room was small but very nice with every thing we required including air conditioning/heating, bathroom with good shower and hair dryer, and a lovely terrace which was an unexpected bonus, even though we were out all the time and didn't get the chance to use it. Would definately return to the Hotel Rimini.

Reviews.Title: “Nice clean place, 100m from Main Railway station, best breakfast coffee”
Reviews.Author: kevyt
Reviews.Content: Clean, handy to the main railway station which also gives you access to the metro.... and therefore access to all parts of Rome. Staff speak good english and were always helpful. Laundromat about 400m away. Nice little bars very close by and a few tourist restaurants. The rooms are ok to good but dont expect too many frills.... its comfortable and very well located. I think its good value for money and i've stayed here twice. The lift is small but it adds to the charm of the place. Breakfast was very good and the coffee, made by an elderly gentleman, was some of the best i have had anywhere in the world

Reviews.Title: “One star for this hotel”
Reviews.Author: LucyB28
Reviews.Content: The only thing good about this hotel is that it is close to the station. The room smelt so bad of cigarettes we asked to be moved to a non smoking room apparently there are no non smoking rooms because in Rome you can smoke where ever you want! We moved to a room which was a little better but still felt like we had smoked a packet of cigarettes after we woke up. The shower head in the bath room wasn't even attached to the wall so you had to hold it while attempting to shower which included flooding the bathroom every time. I have no idea how this is classed as a three star hotel. We ended up losing our two nights accommodation and moving hotels as we couldn't bare breathing in tobacco fumes any longer!! Oh and we may as well have slept on the floor the beds are so hard - not to mention 2 single beds pushed together.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money”
Reviews.Author: pinkprincess_1984_11
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights at Rimini and were very happy with everything. Our room was spacious, with a balcony which was lovely. Staff were friendly and very helpful, free breakfast and wifi. Such close promiximity to the railway station was also fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “A surprise very close to the Termini Station”
Reviews.Author: Naples64
Reviews.Content: We only had 1 night here coming back from Venice and flying out from Rome airport the next morning. We had chosen the hotel for its proximity to the railway station - very close and easy to find. The room was spacious with a balcony and beautifully decorated. There was a spa bath with an over the bath shower. The water from the shower was a little hard to contain as there was no shower curtain or glass...but not a major issue. When we told them we needed to leave at 5.15am the next morning they organised a breakfast for us and had delivered to our room for us without us even asking! You can't ask for much better service than that.

Reviews.Title: “Not to be recommended”
Reviews.Author: Rousesonholiday
Reviews.Content: Hotel very well located for those wanting to be close to the Roma Termini. Firstly we had trouble finding the entrance as it is not well sign posted at walking level. The rooms were dark, ok in size but the walls were paper thin and you could hear toilets being flushed all night. Staff were dismissive and unhelpful, we were locked out of our room twice because they hadn't put in the correct dates of our stay! No apology. No safe. The hotel needs an upgrade as it is very dated. Breakfast was very average.

Reviews.Title: “How much are you prepared to pay for convenience?”
Reviews.Author: Jag-u-rs
Reviews.Content: Convenience, proximity to Termii station, is all this hotel has got going for it. We stayed here twice over a period of a week and we only came back because it was already booked. Both rooms were too small for two people. We had to leave the bathroom to have enough room to dry ourselves. And it is not cheap. Breakfast was ok but that is the only good I can say about it.

Reviews.Title: “Nice enough and conveniently located.”
Reviews.Author: roscoe_love
Reviews.Content: Rimini Hotel is an older but well-maintained establishment. Our room was large, clean and well equipped. The signage outside the hotel wasn't particularly clear so we walked past it a couple of times before finding it (we arrived at night). Bed was hard but comfortable enough and bathroom was spacious. It is located close to Termini train station which was very convenient for getting to and from the airport (there is an express train that is affordable and quick to Fiumicino). The only problem with being close to the train station is that it's not in the prettiest area and it felt a little dodgy at times but one doesn't spend much time in the area while in Rome anyway. The staff were unfriendly, but we found most service people in Rome were. Check-in was unpleasant as the gentleman at the front desk became testy with us because we did not want to leave our passports with him (this is our rule and we haven't encountered problems anywhere else). He seemed bothered that he had to write our information down while we waited. The day we checked in the (tiny!) elevator was broken so we had to carry our bags up 4 flights of stairs but it seemed to work thereafter. Buffet breakfast was good. Air conditioning was wonderful in the sweltering heat of Rome. The shower was small which my 6' 2" husband found awkward. There are a few (alright) restaurants nearby that are open until 11pm or 12am which was good for us as we arrived late and were hungry. Hotel Rimini was absolutely fine for three nights and I'd recommend it if you want a decent hotel that is affordable and in a convenient location.

Reviews.Title: “Try looking into other hotels”
Reviews.Author: DrJetsetter
Reviews.Content: It's adequate for the price you pay. I don't have strong feelings of like or dislike for this hotel. Location is alright because it's close to the train station, however, it is far from the sites so if you can book another 3* hotel elsewhere do so. Concierge were not helpful but not rude either. I will not go back to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, great service”
Reviews.Author: Nicholas A
Reviews.Content: We just came back from our first holiday in Rome. We spent 7 nights at the Rimini Hotel. The location is absolutely perfect...just a minute walk from Stazione Termini. The service from all the staff was very warm and always with a smile. Room was always clean.

Reviews.Title: “Just what we needed..”
Reviews.Author: rhonda1953
Reviews.Content: Great little hotel - very close to the Termini and didnt take long to get to the tourist areas. Our room was reasonably spacious, an ensuite, TV, wonderfully large bed plus a fabulous little courtyard area meaning at the end of each day we could sit, put our feet up and enjoy a few wines. There's a fabulous restaurant nearby called Ristorante Donati which is on the corner of Via Magenta and Via Marghera. It was just fabulous (we ate there 3 times in 2 days!!). The hotel has lots of security cameras which sometimes feels a bit intrusive but probably better to be safe than sorry. They offered to mind our bags as we were a little early. People behind the desk were somewhat serious but that's not the end of the world. We are booked in again to stay next month and are also very much looking forward to more meals at Donati.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: khoward83
Reviews.Content: This was a very nice hotel right by the train station. It was very convenient to drop our luggage and be on our way for sightseeing. It is a bit of a walk to most locations, but it gives you are great opportunity to see all that Rome has to offer. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “What a wonderful city Rome is!”
Reviews.Author: RandL2011
Reviews.Content: This hotel was comfortable but nothing fantastic. It was clean and the service was good. The staff were friendly and their english was very good. The restaurants near by were excellent. However, there is absolutely no parking so don't even think about staying there if you have a car. It is very close to the Central Railway station and the Hop on Hop off bus is also very close by. These are very well organised in Rome but the stops are a long way from many of the attractions. I loved Rome and this hotel is very well situated and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: RhondaSydney
Reviews.Content: Hard to beat the position, close to Termini but not noisy. We had a lovely balcony room where we frequently had drinks and nibbles, supermarket in station to buy food etc. Beautifully decorated room with en suite. Breakfast was plentiful in a pleasant room with view. Very clean throughout. Loved the church bells in the morning, so atmospheric. Staff were friendly and helpful. Free internet but in lounge area but OK. Easy walking distance to many historic sites. Good restaurants nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Comfy and friendly”
Reviews.Author: C0llyMack
Reviews.Content: Stayed during a small group tour of Italy. The hotel is in a good location close to the train station and there are some good eateries and a Spar supermarket nearby. Our rooms varied - one had a big balcony - but it was comfortable and clean and the bathrooms and plentiful hot water get top marksl! There's a small and slow lift and lots of stairs, as in most European hotels. The breakfast room was lovely and the food pretty good. Some quibblers may complain about the church bells at 7am every morning but it makes a very Roman alarm clock. We'd like to thank the hotel staff who were friendly and helpful and were happy to let us set up an art class in the TV lounge on a rainy afternoon. Thoroughly recommend the Rimini.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - beds very hard”
Reviews.Author: Jules50Calgary
Reviews.Content: This hotel is situated very close to Termini Station so you can get anywhere in Rome either by Metro or bus. The City Sightseeing bus is right outside the station. Hotel was very good apart from the beds. The room was the regular size of hotels in Europe. Room was very clean and bathroom had everything we needed. The breakfast was delicious. Unfortunately, the bed was hard so didn't sleep well but I understand that's just the way beds are in Europe. Would recommend for the location and the price.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, great location Rimini Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Robyn0704
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 nights early April. The hotel is walking distance from Termini Station. An older hotel but rooms are nicely renovated & decorated, large rooms & bathrooms and very comfortable and very quiet. Large french doors that open to a courtyard. Not a nice view, but outside shutters could be closed for privacy although the room has quiet airconditioning. Breakfast room is on the 5th floor with a great outlook. Typical European breakfast and great coffee. Small lift, squeeze in 2 people & suitcases but better than no lift. Free wifi in Lounge on 1st floor. Plenty of shops, cafes & restaurants in the immediate vicinity including those in the Termini Stazione. Very friendly & helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “great location - huge bathroom!”
Reviews.Author: BertienBryce
Reviews.Content: The Rimini is rather strangely mixed through with the Corot next door, and we stayed in both due to a mix up with dates (ours, not the hotel). We moved from the Corot to the Rimini for our final night which actually meant taking our bags up one flight of stairs. Everything said about the Corot applies equally to the Rimini. Great location, good breakfast, friendly staff - what more could you want on a short break. And the room we were allocated was huge, with the biggest bathroom I have ever had in any hotel - a really nice surprise.

Reviews.Title: “Superb service and location”
Reviews.Author: 40nt0ur
Reviews.Content: We were a little worried having read some of the reviews - no need! Location was ideal Not in the least bit worried being out and about day or night So easy for transfer to and from airport, trains. buses, metro or just walking around Rome All the staff were incredibly helpful and friendly especially Matteo a real star! Yes the carpet is well worn and the lift is quite small but rooms spotlessly clean, comfortable and warm Breakfast was plentiful and again the staff were friendly and helpful Would definitely stay here again Lots of restaurants within the area Try the Donati food and atmosphere really good - the tourist set meal was particularly good value

Reviews.Title: “Thumbs up hotel”
Reviews.Author: IngerBonde
Reviews.Content: Lovely near Termini station and in good walking distance to everything. We were very surprised by the room's size and especially the bathroom. See pictures. Perhaps the stairwell good penetration for a new carpet and the morningbuffé is nothing to write about. But on the other hand, breakfast is not what most Romans do best. Therefore it's better to find a restaurant with respect for good Italian food and have a fantastic lunch, then you are ready to experience ROMA. We were at the hotel for 5 days (4 nights) and we will gladly come back.

Reviews.Title: “A good choice of the many 3-star hotels next to the rail station.”
Reviews.Author: 5murrell
Reviews.Content: The main reason for staying here was the closeness to the railway station - just one block. Nearly every second building in this area seems to be a small hotel and the Rimini was a good choice for its class of accommodation. The reception was friendly and helpful. The room was large, clean and comfortable and the en suite was modern and clean. The restaurant on the top floor provided a good breakfast, even if the choice was limited. One down side is the tiny, old-fashioned elevator which is often too small for the number of guests. The hotel provides a free wi-fi hot spot on the first floor. There are several good restaurants in the neighbourhood and it is easy to get a good evening meal.

Reviews.Title: “Well located, friendly staff, clean and comfortable small hotel”
Reviews.Author: TwoAussieBabyBoomers
Reviews.Content: My friend and I ( 2 baby boomer ladies) started and ended our 1 month experience in Italy at the Hotel Rimini. We wanted a hotel close to the station in Rome for convenience. We stayed 2 nights on our arrival and 1 night before flying out. We were catching trains to and from Rome so wanted a hotel close by and it is less than 5 minutes walk. There are some good restaurants in the area and we were able to walk to a number of historic sites comfortably. The breakfasts are great the rooms are very comfortable, we required a twin room and that was not a problem. We did arrive in on an early flight so our room was not available but we were able to leave our luggage at reception until the room was ready. Would recommend a stay here given its city accommodation at a quite reasonable rate.

Reviews.Title: “Ever reliable”
Reviews.Author: helsaAustralia
Reviews.Content: The Rimini is a good representative of the 3 star category and we have stayed here 5 times since 2006. The rooms are not large but the beds are! The bathrooms are tiny but clean. If you are lucky you might get a room with a terrace which makes the whole accommodation seem bigger. The street noise is muted by double glazing if you wish to shut it out. The desk staff have always been helpful. We ave certainly never seen any evidence of rudeness. The breakfast is plentiful and the variety very acceptable. The area is very convenient for trains and buses and is not as bad as it is often described. All large railway stations attract an interesting crowd and this one is no different, There are lots of places to buy coffee or have a meal including the excellent self service Gusto in the station.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Gem!”
Reviews.Author: Disjecta
Reviews.Content: After we lucked out with our Florence hotel, we were slightly apprehnsive with this place. It's near the Rome Termini station (and Metro and bus/tram terminal) - just 100m or so. And we've heard of infamous stories of this somewhat rough neighbourhood. But our fears were unfounded, this was a great hotel! Great staff all round, friendly, helpful by Rome's standards. We were upgraded. The airconditioned room was well-sized, clean and big. The view is... uninteresting, for lack of a better word, even on the rooftop 'garden'. Everything looks new (or at least recently renovated). Breakfast is served on the 5th floor. Nothing exceptional but it's alright. Ask for a cappuccino, the standard/american coffee they serve is awful. Wi-fi internet was not free but quite cheap at One Euro an hour. Do note though, that you can only use it (or have good reception) in the TV room, second floor. Our room was adjacent to some water pipe or system thingie, it was on the whole night. But Rome will seriously exhaust you so we fell asleep without much trouble.

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly good”
Reviews.Author: feedbackthetruth
Reviews.Content: Really close to Termini train station. Small hotel but seems to share space with the hotel next door. Better value for money than at more expensive supposedly 4 star hotels in similar area. Was given nice room with big bathroom which appeared to have been recently renovated. Reception staff friendly. Breakfast the usual fare. Made fresh coffee if you spoke Italian but other wise the automatic machine was in use. Would definitely stay here again if just for the night and travelling by train.

Reviews.Title: “Convient & comfortable”
Reviews.Author: 45annie
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this hotel several times over the last few years and find it very comfortable, breakfast is good and the rooms have all that is required. We had a room with a terrace which was great. The hotel is only metres from the Rome terminal station so it is easy to catch the regional trains or the metro anywhere in Italy. There is a supermarket in the station and there are lots of shops around that area. We stayed for 5 days and the staff were very friendly and helpful. I would stay again when in Rome and would certainly recommend this hotel to friends. The price was very reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “brilliant value for money”
Reviews.Author: longtravellingcat
Reviews.Content: Very surprised at the brilliant quality of the hotel for the price paid. Staff very friendly and helpful. Breakfast was sufficient, local resturants and food stores for lunch and dinner. Room was perfectly clean and spacious. Extremely close to the train station. Only problem was not the nicest area but excellent for a budget holiday and prime location for travelling around the city. Lovely hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Still good choice for 55 euro night )))”
Reviews.Author: RussGuy
Reviews.Content: It was my second visit to Rome (roundway from Bari) and i booked a room there only for good sleeping, cose knew - that hotel have good position - just few meters from Roma Termini. Room (601) was at the upper floor and was nice for 1 person...just WC is very small - lust time 2 years ago we stayed at 3rd floor and bathroom was very large. Breackfast was included to the room price - cheese, coffe, bread, meat and cerals. Simple but good for open yours eyes. ))) Room clean, but no Internet (LAN or WiFi).

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, shame about the standard of the rooms”
Reviews.Author: Skåneräv
Reviews.Content: The hotel claims to be 3 star, don't believe it, you will be severely disappointed, it is at best 2 star. If you are lucky enough to be able to book in advance check out the major chains for offers, we paid 120 euros for our room per night which was far too much when I discovered we could have stayed in a really nice Mercure for less money. Location wise, its good, a very short walk from the Termini station. The entrance, is more an alleyway than a hotel lobby. at the back of which you'll find a room that is the reception. The staff there are very friendly and welcoming, I really couldn't fault them. Once you have your room, you can either travel up in the very small, very slow lift or walk up the very well worn stair carpets to the highest floors where you can also enjoy the exhibit of dust that has built up on the outside of the lift. The lower floors of the building are used by another hotel - the Corot - the rooms of which better live up to the 3 stars than the Rimini does. The room, rag washed blue painted walls with cracks, very small, just enough space for a desk and a double bed. No blankets on that bed though and sheets so thin you can clearly see the pattern of the mattress underneath. Even though I am sure the sheets were clean, I did not feel clean after sleeping in the bed which was not one of the newest. We saw several ants crossing the floor of our room and we were unable to get the air conditioning to cool. The furniture was worn out, with cup rings on the bedside tables and the desk. In the morning we had a lovely view from our room, a dirty courtyard at the bottom of which all the buildings connected to the courtyard kept their rubbish bins. That explained the delightful smell in the room later in the day. The bathroom was of a much better standard than the room though the hair dryer was dirty with old dried in lipstick stains and did not feel clean enough to want to use. There was no internet in the hotel although the Corot did have a wireless service, sadly as a Rimini guest we couldn't use it even though the two hotels share the same buidling. The breakfast was very good though it was a real shame they couldn't provide real juice in the morning instead of sugary, oversweet concentrate mixed with water. The breakfast room, like the rooms in the hotel was in desperate need of updating, it seemed that a radiator had been removed from the wall in that room a long time ago but they have still not got around to paining the wall where it once was. If you do stay here and need somewhere to have dinner, try the Ristorante Donati a few doors down. They have really good food and very reasonable prices.

Reviews.Title: “Good friendly clean hotel, close to all amenties and transport”
Reviews.Author: dogsdogs
Reviews.Content: We only stayed over night in Rome and found this hotel well priced, very convenient, friendly staff and receptionist, excellent breakfasts and very clean rooms. We would stay there again and have recommended this hotel to our New Zealand friends back home.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Fats75
Reviews.Content: Have been to Roma a few times and will always stay at this hotel. The location from Temini is great, the staff are friendly and the rooms are comfortable and well maintained. The breakfast is good with a good range of food on offer. There a couple of very nice restuarants downstairs to the right as you walk out of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Ten Steps from the Roma Termini - Convenient and Good Value”
Reviews.Author: AussieFemale35
Reviews.Content: Can't get a better location if you are needing a night's stay in Rome before flying out in the morning. No complaints with the hotel but wouldn't recommend it for a long term stay in Rome, since although the location is convenient to the station, it's on a pretty shabby block and doesn't feel safe to loiter on the street outside. Breakfast was good.

Reviews.Title: “great location and value for central rome”
Reviews.Author: crissyPerth
Reviews.Content: Stayed in hotel rimini for 4 nights from 30th march 2009. we had booked 2 rooms 1 twin room for my sister in law and i to share and a triple room for my husband and 2 sons. Our room was a reasonable size although our bathroom was quite small and a little tired it was clean, the bathroom in the triple room was huge and also clean.The beds were comfortable and the white sheets felt lovely, we also had a safe in our rooms. which was handy. The breakfast which was included in the price was adequate with a good variety of pastries, cereal ,breads, cheese,cold meat , omelete,juices etc.The ladies running the breafast room were all polite and curtious, would make your coffee individually and to your liking. I would not rate this hotel more than a 3 star but for location definately a 5 star only 50metres or less to termini station which is handy if you need to catch the train and have a lot of luggage to carry. We found the staff friendly and helpfull would help us with the city map and would let us know the best way of getting to locations and would let us know where to be extra carefull of our personal posessions, they also organise day trips for you and were happy to organise our day trip to pompei. overall i would definatelly stay here again on our next trip to rome but if you are looking for a luxurious hotel then this is not the one for you, we were very happy with our stay and would recommend this for location.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed, does not live up the the reviews! Not 3 Stars!”
Reviews.Author: travel_bunny222
Reviews.Content: We needed a place to stay for 1 night as we were arriving late into Rome and had to be at the Roma Termini early the following morning. We just needed a convenient place to sleep. After reading the reviews on tripadvisor, we were confident that the hotel would be clean. WRONG! This place is a DIVE! Definitely SHOULD NOT be rated a 3 Star hotel. The hotel is run-down and felt more like a 1Star hotel... I think some of the Motel 6's in the US are in better condition! Another review commented on the elevator being small! They were right, the elevator barely fits 2 Large suitcases along with 2 people... but at the time of booking we were not concerned with the elevator as we just wanted a nice place to sleep and since the other reviews claimed the hotel was "clean and spotless" we booked this hotel. BAD IDEA! The reception area smelled damp and musky... and the man at the desk was not very friendly... we checked in at around 1am and were tired... so we didn't realize that he had kept our passports until the next morning. If you are not comfortable with this, MAKE SURE TO ASK FOR IT BACK. They are not very secure as the passports are siply kept in a cubbyhole and can be easily stolen. The carpets in the hallway were extremely dirty and worn down. The room itself definitely needed updating. The room was very dark, not very good lighting. The bed comforter has hairs that weren't ours! It was obvious it had not been cleaned... The sheets themselves were crisp and clean thought (or at least appeared to be). The wallpaper in out room was worn and areas of it had started peeling.... The washroom floor has not been cleaned properly as it still had hairs and dust in the corners.... the worse part was that there was a pubic hair on the wondow ledge next to the toilet! That was disgusting! But we were too tired to complain and it didnt seem like the man at the reception would have offered much help anyways and we were too tired to request a room change... we figured we would onlt be sleeping for 6 hours then keaveing anyways... The location is very good though. Extremely convenient as it is only a 5 minute walk from Roma Termini. I definitely would not recomment staying here for more than 1 night.... but if you just need a place to stay, like we did, the location is great. If you're here on honeymoon or looking for a romantic place to stay, THIS IS NOT IT!! It is merely a place to sleep that is in a convenient location. When we returned to Rome 3 days later, we booked at Hotel YES, which is also classified as 3 Star and the same price..... it is only another block down... if you can book the Hotel YES instead! It is the same price.. but FAR BETTER quality and the staff at the front desk are super friendly and helpful. Compared to the Hotel RImini, the Yes Hotel is a far better value. Hope this helps... cause I find that a lot of the earlier reviews did not honestly reflect the poor condition on the Hotel Rimini....

Reviews.Title: “Good place, good price, Great Value!”
Reviews.Author: nathb189
Reviews.Content: My hubsband and I were in Rome at the end of September 08, and stayed at the Rimini for 3 days. I booked the Rimini because of the good critics from Tripadvisor and I do not regret it at all! It was a reasonable price and a 5 minutes walk from the Termini with heavy luggage was also a big plus. If I do remember well we were on the 5th floor. Not a huge room but very clean, we even had a balcony (but who has time to stay in their room in Rome?) The breakfast was also very nice, it really had everything. Not a cheap continental breakfast here! We did talk a couple of time to man at the front desk and he was always very courteous and helpful. The best thing about this hotel is really its proximity to the Termini. From there you can go anywhere very easily (Vatican, Subway, train station, Airport, etc). Would I go back to that hotel? I would say yes in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “Good budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: J_on_tour1
Reviews.Content: Good budget accomodation. Bedrooms were clean and a nice decor with air conditioning but unfortunately the bathroom we had could have done with some modernisation although we did not find this a problem. The 6 floors of the hotel are served by an old fashioned lift which is like something out of a department store. It is meant to hold three people, yeah right, that will be without bags! The buffet breakfast was good and suitable for this star rating with various cooked eggs, hams, cheeses, bread, fruit and croissants. The hotel could not have been handier for transport links of train, metro and buses. Rome is not really a udget city for accomodation but Rimini was a good standard at this price all things considered. If i returned to Rome, this would certainly be the first hotel i would look at for accomodation.

Reviews.Title: “Dont fall for the apartment line!”
Reviews.Author: SenorSmith
Reviews.Content: We initially booked this hotel because of its close location to the train station (we arrived from the airport and took the train in). We arrived late morning to be greeted by a surly looking chap in reception. Initially he told us we had no reservation. After we produced a confirmation letter with the reservation code he immediately changed his tune and told us currently all the rooms were being cleaned, so he'd put us up in an apartment around the corner. This sounded ilke a good idea at first (who wouldnt prefer an apartment over a hotel room?). How wrong I was. 'Around the corner" actually meant a 10 minute walk away, into a much more seedy looking area (my wife said she didnt feel safe). The apartment was big, but quite dirty. We contemplated trying to change back to a room but after carrying our luggage all the way plus the flight, we just didnt have the energy. Luckily we were only staying 2 nights and were out sightseeing most of the time. But I'd recommend if you do book this hotel, and get offered an apartment upon check-in, politely decline it.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at hotel Rimini in Rome”
Reviews.Author: CristianBordei
Reviews.Content: I’ve stayed at the Rimini Hotel for a week in February 2007, in a double room for which I have paid 80 Euro / night by voucher from the travel agency. The main trump of the hotel is his central location, being placed at 2 minutes walking from Termini central station (and related subway station) and 3 minutes from Cinquecento Place where many busses have their end-stops. At the same time there are very good connections with the airports through the shuttle bus lines (the stop is near the railway station) – 30 minutes to Fiumicino (Leonardo da Vinci) and 40 minutes to Ciampino. The endowments of the rooms complies with and even exceeds the 3*** standard and breakfast is buffet type. Because I was very content with the stay at Rimini Hotel, I bought again 2 twin rooms for 3 nights at beginning of November 2008, at the same price, for my relatives. On their return they thanked me for the choice I made, telling me they were very pleased with this hotel and with the services offered (very quick check-in and check-out, cleanliness, comfort and soundproofness of the rooms). Another good mark for the kindness of the staff and especially for the manager Massimo Alessi, always ready to solve any request regarding the stay at the hotel and to provide full information about the transport in Rome and the places worth visiting. I’ll choose the Rimini Hotel for my next visit in Rome as well and I recommend it to all tourists, irrespective of age, who want to profit by the services of a good hotel at decent prices.

Reviews.Title: “Very convenient for overnight stay if catching train the next day”
Reviews.Author: labrajak
Reviews.Content: Basic, old small hotel, clean, with nice modern bathroom. Approx 50 metres to Rome Railway Termina which was great for overnight. Basic breakfast. Friendly staff and nothing was too much trouble. Highly recommend for a night as we were catching the train to Venice the next morning. No hassles getting cases to, and onto train. We usually stay in much better and more expensive places but this Hotel suited our needs. Would stay there again for convenience. Was recommended by our friends. A fair walk to main tourist places but as we had spent time in Rome 2 years ago, it was great to revisit our favourite places again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value For Money”
Reviews.Author: JarrodMelbourne
Reviews.Content: I Stayed in Rimini November 07 and found it to be good value for what you pay. The rooms are fine, better than what we expected, compared to other places around Rome that are double in price and very dodgy. It is very central being next to the main train station, we even walked to the Colosseum, which is quite a walk but good exercise. We found the staff to be nice enough, you can get some poor hotel staff around Europe. I would say Rimini is a good stop over place. If you want to spend 2-3 days exploring Rome and then move on to another destination i don't think you could better, being so close to the train station.

Reviews.Title: “Good *** hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: alanandee
Reviews.Content: You never know what you are going to get when you book over the Net, but we were happy this time. The hotel is literally 50 metres from the railway station, but far enough away from the really heavy foot and road traffic. There was some slight noise in the morning but the double glazed windows and shutters deflected most of it. The bathroom was big and clean with a spa bath and jet shower. The room (408) was spacious, clean and well appointed enough that we re-booked for the over nighter we had to do in Rome before we had to fly out of Italy. We were warmly welcomed. As previously mentioned by other guests, the breakfast is excellant. The location is perfect for exploring all of Romas' main attractions in 1 day, or more. I didn't feel intimidated by the area immediately around the hotel at night. There is a supermarket in the Railway Station (downstairs), and internet stalls close by. I must mention that I too, slept in the hardest bed of my life. But, I did sleep. And the one time there was a problem with the electrics, someone came within 20 minutes to check on it.

Reviews.Title: “Termini so Handy”
Reviews.Author: MSCFH
Reviews.Content: Just returned from Rome and stayed at the Rimini with my daughter and two friends. Within one-half block of the train station where you can catch a train to Pompeii or to Fiumicino, so it is very handy. We had a room with twin beds on the fifth floor(maybe our sixth) with a lovely balcony, and our friends were next door in a larger nicer room. The walls are upholstered and the rooms were spotlessly clean. A more modern decorating scheme and some modern lighting and art would have helped the appearance, but the breakfast was great and plentiful. (Better than an 18 euro breakfast we had elsewhere) Not the most charming neighborhood, but convenient for transportation with good trattorias within walking distance. Good value for the price

Reviews.Title: “Just right”
Reviews.Author: ndcmuna
Reviews.Content: Hotel Rimini was the smallest of the 3 hotels we stayed at in Rome. The bed was average but clean and sheets changed daily. Room and bathroom were cleaned daily and towels were replaced daily. It was the perfect place for us especially since we only needed a clean bed to sleep in and a place to shower; otherwise, we were out all day. Hotel Rimini is located very close to the Termini-about a 5 minute walk. Once you exit the area where the tracks are you make a right and head for the side exit - Via Marghera (the street where the hotel is on) is right in front of you. Since it was close to the Termini it didn't take long for us to catch a RED hop-on/hop off bus to different sites in the city and it is easy access to the Metro. They had a great breakfast spread and they made fresh coffee per person when requested (they have an espresso/coffee bar machine) which they served to you in your own personal coffee pot. I have no complaints about this hotel-would definitley recommend it to anyone who needs a convenient place to stay in but it is definitely not a hotel for a romantic getwaway as it had a motel-like quality to it.

Reviews.Title: “Possibly the hardest bed in europe~!!”
Reviews.Author: kiwi_NZ_67
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the rimini for 1 night prior to starting a tour. Hotel is 1 mins walk from the termini even with heavy suitcases- an easy walk. Met at reception by a grumpy middle aged man who didnt want to talk with a woman, but was ok with my husband once he knew he was into grand prix racing. This was a pity as I had dealt via email with the lovely Massimo (manager) previously and the man on reception told me "not to bother about him" when I mentioned his name. The city area is dirty compared to the beauty of Tuscany but is close to sights like the coliseum (took us 20 mins by foot) We were told that around the hotel/termini, there are lots of drug dealers and prostitues out at night, however we had no problems when going out earlier at night for dinner. The room - a triple, sounds like the worst in the hotel after reading more recent reviews!! It was clean but dingy and so dark you had to have the lights on all the time. It was very very cramped for 3 of us. Worst complaint was the bed- after sleeping in 30 hotels in europe in 2 months, this was the hardest bed I have ever tried to sleep on, it was like lying on a table. In the end, I had to transfer our sleeping child into the bed and I slept in her roll away camp stretcher!! My husband fared only a little better!! Nice breakfast included however the next day. Probably wouldnt stay there again. Expensive for what it is even allowing for the fact you are in Roma, considering the state of the room and the service.

Reviews.Title: “good rooms, ordinary location”
Reviews.Author: kathryn5353
Reviews.Content: This hotel is within 500 metres of the main train station, an attraction in itself, when coming in from the airport. Although seasoned travelers probably know that the Train station precincts of all cities tend to be somewhat seedy.. We were worried initially, coming off a minor street and entering a small, and somewhat ordinary, reception area. The welcome was reasonably professional, but the lift, which only one of us at a time could enter with our suitcases, had us really concerned that the room would be awful. NOT SO. The room was surprisingly spacious, considering we were in a built up area of Rome. The bathroom was especially impressive.. newly remodelled, sparkling, clean and large. The room had every necessity and whilst the view from our window was only of a side street.. it was a sidestreet IN ROME... mopeds and street traders abounding! When in Rome etc... The decore was fine, if they had just chosen a more neutral colour than buttercup yellow for their walls. Bedding and bathroom linen: soft and comfortable. Breakfasts were plentiful ,and reasonably varied... Served in a very pleasant room upstairs. Eat as much as you want! As this hotel is literally next to the train station, it is great for arrival from, or access to, the airport. But do not use this area as your entertainment locale. There is really nothing attractive or engaging about this part of Rome, other than its accessibility to the parts you want to see, via train, bus or open top tour bus. I had my purse stolen whilst walking through this area.. the concierge at the Rimini was SO apologetic that this had happened in his city! The police; far less concerned. However, if you want to truly see parts of foreign cities which the travel brochures do not advertise; to get a real feel for a city or to utilise local transport, I cannot recommend this hotel more favourably. Well priced and within train, bus or (if you're energetic) walking distance of all the popular Rome sites. The Hotel offers honest, quality accomodation at a good price.. everything else is up to you.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel, Good Price, Very Satisfied”
Reviews.Author: Penny22Florida
Reviews.Content: Within a block of Termini train station read other reviews that said it was not a great area, but never felt threatened Lovely room Little alcove with shuttered doors leading to patio Clean, clean, clean and cozy Maid service great Breakfast great, all you can eat buffet, something for everyone: 3 cereal choices, milk, several juices, bottled water, fresh fruit, yogurt, croissants (heated), breakfast pastries, crusty rolls, breads for toasting, jams, variety of meats, cheese, hard boiled eggs and scrambled eggs. Breakfast staff very accommodating and efficient, brought café Americano and decaf cappuccino to table every morning, after a few days knew what we’d be ordering Staff helpful and friendly Very happy with our room, with small balcony, very cute Not terribly close to attractions, took public transportation easily Kiosk for bus info (but not tickets) at bus terminal just outside terminal Generous sized towels, hair dryer sufficient, provided bath/shampoo gel, shower caps, but Americans, be warned, most places in Europe don’t usually provide washcloths, so if it’s a necessity for you, take your own. Safe in room for valuables Safe place to stay Very firm beds! Maid left us extra pillows when she saw we had folded up a blanket under our pillows Maid very cheerfully showed us how to work the light and a/c Plenty of drawer and hanging space for clothes Great a/c Would definitely stay again, no question Great value Provided Waiting room while room is prepared (we arrived from US at 9 am, room was ready in about an hour, we were thrilled!) Small lift, which we find to be typical in Europe, not a problem, we both fit in with 2 suitcases Would absolutely and definitely stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value”
Reviews.Author: NZCoupleAuckland
Reviews.Content: We decided to have 4 days in Rome prior to leaving on our tour and we are so pleased we did. We arrived at the hotel mid morning after a long flight and the staff offered us a toilet/shower to freshen up while our room was being prepared. And what a pleasant surprise our room was. It was large and clean with a king size bed and the connecting bathroom was huge. A real delight. Breakfast was also excellent with a wonderful buffet offering a large selection. The hotel is so convenient to Termini Station - practically across the road and there is a good selection of restaurants nearby. Well recommended.

Reviews.Title: “clean hotel, friendly staff, walking distance to termini station”
Reviews.Author: LAURA1981
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel on August 5th and August 17th, 2007. Both of our rooms were clean, however, the room we had been given on the 6th floor during our second night stay was bigger, and had a much larger bathroom with a separate shower and bath tub. Next time, I will definitely ask for a room on the 6th floor. The hotel is nice and quiet, despite the fact it is located just steps away from Termini Station. Staff is friendly, although the desk clerk botched up our wake up call for the morning of August 18th. It was a good thing we woke up on our own, or we would have missed our flight back to Canada. Breakfast was decent. Being it was included in the price of the hotel, I believe enough was provided. They had croissants, cereal, 3 types of juice, coffee, seasonal fruits, fruit cocktail, tomato salad, a platter or cheeses, some pound cake and other pastry and toast. Overall, I would say that this hotel was worth the price we paid. It was not at all expensive, it was clean, it had friendly staff, and it provided a decent breakfast. We will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Basic hotel”
Reviews.Author: Malaga.Spain
Reviews.Content: Rimini is a basic hotel located next door to Termini. Don´t stay here if you are looking for a charming hotel. Ask for a room on the 6th floor which I think are the best. The Bed is old and not very confortable, AC works ok. Room is small but clean, Breakfast is buffet but very basic.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel for a short break in rome”
Reviews.Author: waelfarhat
Reviews.Content: Stayed there 3 nights since aug 1.we were offered a tiny and small room that nearly fits to one person.after complaining, we were moved to room 610 which was ok for 2 persons.the room is clean, but the bathroom is a bit old fashioned and had no curtain, so when taking a bath water is everwhere.The hotel is very close to termini station , where u can catch early trains to florence and other destinations.it is a bit far from the touristic sites like the vatican,trevi fountain, navona square ....The reception staff were rude, they didn't want to reconfirm my flight so i had to do it myself.Breakfast is ok.not recommended.

Reviews.Title: “OK and close to station”
Reviews.Author: Mitchsis
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Rimini for four nights and found it to be perfectly OK. Mildly surprised at rave reviews here though. The rooms are clean but tiny. The staff barely said a word. There was an overwhelming spell of bleach at times ...even in the drinks at breakfast!! I am normally an 'as long as its clean' merchant and don't really bother whether a place is particularly plush. So the Rimini is fine but I wouldn't go as far as some reviews here and say it is fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for catching early trains”
Reviews.Author: tropicgirl39
Reviews.Content: We stayed here overnight last month (in May 2007). The rooms were well decorated and clean. Breakfast was good. Whilst it is VERY close (less than 5 minutes walk) to Stazione Termini which is very handy if you are catching an early train elsewhere; it is not a central location if you want to explore the Fontana Di Trevi, Spanish Steps, Pantheon; Piazza Navona, Campo Di Fiori or the Vatican. In fact it is a good 1/2 hour walk to most attractions. I was also a bit put off when I enquired about a restaurant I had read about and was told that if we were staying more than one night they would have helped us find that restaurant. All in all an OK experience. For those needing to be close to Stazione Termini it is a good choice. For those looking for a hotel in a location within walking distance of most monuments, pick somewhere than is not close to Stazione Termini.

Reviews.Title: “Best location to stay in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Nawka_BLR
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel from "haystack.lonelyplanet.com" at 80EUR a night for 3 nights in first week of March 2007. I was travelling with my wife and i felt that this hotel was "Real Value for Money". With EUR80 and hotel like Rimini, I thoght it was a steal. The room was average. The bathroom was spacious. The elevator in the hotel is very small. Say 2 persons with 2 bags and its full! The best part about this hotel is its location.... The hotel is situated about 2 mins walk from the Termini Station that has the metro and the connections of EURAIL. The hotel is also about 5 mins from the tourist office of Rome where they have friendly english speaking attendents. Just adjacent to the hotel is a sort of a business centre having all email/ fax/ telephone facilities at very cheap rates. The hotel is about 25-30 mins walk from most of the sights in Rome (Spanish Steps/ Trevi etc.) The metro from Termini connects to vatican in under 10 mins! We felt that the persons in front desk / reception of the hotel could be more friendly! The breakfast (incl. in room rent) had a HUGE spread. Good collection of teas.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money”
Reviews.Author: KLR80
Reviews.Content: I always use the internet for reviews when booking any hotel but have to confess I never get round to writing my own! However I was so impressed with Hotel Rimini I felt I should contribute.. We stayed at the Hotel Rimini for 3 nights at the beginning of April 07. We had a double room which was pretty spacious and very clean. The bathroom wasn't massive but was perfectly adequate and again everything was very clean and fresh towels, linen etc. were provided daily. Staff were (mostly) friendly and helpful and spoke good English, which was great given our limited Italian vocabulary! Breakfast was great - lots of variety - cereals, croissants, bread rolls, ham, cheese, toast and jam, loads of fruit juices and fresh tea/coffee brought to your table. One of the reception guys recommended a restaurant which is just round the corner - I can't remember the name of it but I think they will recommend the same one to people - which was a fantastic place, very good prices and really lovely staff. One of the biggest things going for this hotel is the location - literally 2 mins to the Termini station which has the main trains from FCO airport and also the metro which gets you to most of the main attractions. You can also walk to many places if you don't mind a bit of a walk; the colosseum is about 20 mins by foot. Overall, the hotel was great!! Most of all, very good value for money as it was one of the cheapest ones I looked at whilst still being in the city centre. Wopuld definately recommend and would definately stay again!

Reviews.Title: “A Great Base”
Reviews.Author: Hoodster
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Rimini from 15 - 19 March 2007. Our room (604) was a decent size, bright, modern and comfortable. The bathroom was medium sized and very clean, with a good powerful, hot shower. The room was cleaned every day and new towels provided. As previously mentioned, the lift is quite small but remarkably quiet and it is better than braving the stairs to the 6th floor. There are the usual complimentary bathroom "condiments" and a hair dryer, but I'd advise bringing your own. There is also a small mini bar in the room. The shutters on the windows keep the light out so effectively that we had no idea whether it was day or night when we woke up. The breakfast room is large and bright and the food is plentiful and of good quality. There were four of us and we had booked 2 superior rooms, although on arrival only one room was booked and we were told "all the rooms are the same". By the look of some of the other reviews here, this may not necessarily be the case. One down side was that our neighbour was an early riser so we could clearly hear the shower running and toilet flushing. Ear plugs would be recommended for those wanting a lie in. Some of the hotel staff were pleasant and helpful, the others were no more than efficient, but we didn't experience any blatant rudeness. I found the hotel's location perfect for getting around the city. You can buy a Metrebus pass in a shop in Termini station (16 Euro for a 7 day pass) and use it for jumping on and off the metro and bus. There are many restaurants nearby and we didn't experience any problems with the area. Overall, while Rimini is not the most luxurious hotel you'll find in Rome, it's location is very convenient and the hotel itself perfectly acceptable.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, very friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: PamelaandBarry
Reviews.Content: We would strongly recommend this hotel. The staff were very friendly and we were upgraded to the 'honeymoon' suite, with its own kitchen, bathroom (with shower), tv, very comfortable bed and roof-top terrace, which at the end of February was ideal as the weather was quite nice (about 13-15 Celsius). Although it was close to Termini, this area has an unnecessarily bad press - there is a decent supermarket downstairs in the station, plenty of shops and whilst crowded, the people are not aggressive or unfriendly, just busy! This hotel is a little walk from the station, but our room was VERY quiet, there was always hot water and with our little kitchen, we could cook or make sandwiches without any problem. The staff were very friendly and we received our wake-up call on our departing morning without any problems. Any problems (such as a broken key at midnight) was quickly sorted out and I am sure that if other difficulties had surfaced or had bothered us, I am sure that the staff would have resolved those as quickly and as friendly as the 'key' problem. That said, the hotel is far from the pantheon and the vatican, but for those willing to walk and wander, the colosseum and antica roma are quite near. Beware the taxi touts at Termini! Fortunately, we knew enough Italian not to be scammed by a driver who tried to charge for sunday (on saturday!) and for luggage (when we didn't have any) and then was resigned in good humour when argued with. Strong recommendations. This is a good value, friendly 2-3star European hotel, which should appeal to couples and families.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: Kayser10
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located very close to the entrance of Termini Station, which is very convenient if you are travelling by train. We stayed in 2 different rooms as we had checked out to travel to other parts of Italy during our vacation. Both rooms were in good condition and very clean. One of the bathrooms was rather small (with a rather dodgy shower screen) while the other bathroom was excellent, with a nice bath tub & all. The breakfast spread was good, with lots of variety,e.g.pastries, bread, cereals, fruits, cappucino & juices. However, the staff could attempt to be friendlier, otherwise they are relatively helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Simple and Effective”
Reviews.Author: steveqpr
Reviews.Content: Once again, another Hotel booked on the basis of Trip Advisor traveller reviews and, once again they were completely trustworthy. We arrived at the Rimini courtesy of http://www.romelimousines.com/ a (relatively) cheap but completely trustworthy and way of transfering from the airport. As is mentioned in other reviews the Rimini is near the main train station and although some might see this as a slight downside in view of the noise and some of the clientele that this type of area attracts I can only say that we experienced no noise whatsoever and the throng of people surrounding the area is no different to any other part of Rome. In short we didn't feel uncomfortable walking in the area at any time so the whereabouts of the Rimini shouldn't put you off at all - in fact it's possible to walk around Rome using the Rimini as a base if you don't fancy using the Metro (our feet gave in to this option after the first day!). Entering the Rimini through the main doors on the street brings you face to face with a small, clean, friendly Reception area and as is mentioned the small lift. We managed to fit ourselves and two cases in the lift at a squeeze so unless you have more luggage than Snoop Dogg's entourage you won't have a problem transporting your bags. Rooms are what I'd describe as 'comfortable' not large but big enough to enable a wander around the beds without having to breathe in or knock the TV off the dressing table. Our bathroom was clean, the shower was very powerful and water hot and plentiful - the ONLY downside was the hairdryer (according to my wife!) as the stream of air was luke warm at best. The hairdryer 'issue' was evident at breakfast where the damp haired ladies crowding around the croissant's wouldn't have looked out of place around an Olympic swimming pool. The breakfast area is on the 5th floor and there is plenty to choose from, Pastry, Meats, Bread and Cereals are all on the menu although waitress service isn't exactly prominent and to obtain a coffee meant getting out of your seat and approaching one of the waitresses in situ as opposed to them coming to you. Still, it's not an onerous task and the quality of the food available more than makes up for it. So, to precis this rather long winded review - The Rimini a good option for those willing to sacrifice the luxury of a more expensive Hotel for a decent nights sleep, hearty breakfast and a location that is extremely convenient to explore Rome's historic sights.

Reviews.Title: “Very presentable & nice”
Reviews.Author: JohnandLisa
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Rimini in September 2006, on recommendations from friends. Great location - easly walk from the Stazione Termini (after catching the train in from the airport), & not one set of stairs. Yes, the lift is small, but fine for 2 suitcases & one person. The room was excellent - quite large, nice & dark (a little noise from the restaurant below, but didn't prevent sleep), and an excellent bathroom. Especially loved the "spa" feature in the shower, just what was needed after a long day walking around Rome. Breakfast was by far the best we had in Italy - choice of cereals, yogurt, fresh fruit, cold meats, cheese and boiled eggs & omelettes and juices. Could also get a hot chocolate at breakfast time, which was great. Quite a few restaurants within walking distance from the hotel, all seemed good, also a laundromat a couple of blocks away.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Great service, 50 metres from Termini, Value for $$$”
Reviews.Author: Jodus
Reviews.Content: We read the other reviews before trying it and thought we'd give it a go. We were not disappointed. We took a bit of a risk by not pre-booking and booked our room at the hotel reservation service at Rome airport. Paid 90 euros per night inc breakfast. Reservation fee was 3 euros for this service at the airport. Hotel is located 50 metres from Termini railway station which makes carting even the largest of suitcases relatively easy. The room was clean and the furnishing and fixtures we guess is under 5 years old. After subsequently travelling the majority of Italy we have now realised that Hotel Rimini has a room and breakfast standard that exceeds most in its class. Air con and shower was good, as was the fridge. Breakfast was also above par, including hot and cold buffet consisting of the traditional croissants, rolls, hams and cheeses, PLUS cooked eggs and bacon, great range of cereal and jogurt, REAL orange juice, and coffee made to order (eg. espresso, cappacino, late, etc.). Easy access to all sites via the train and bus network 50 metres away at Termini. Whilst Termini may have a bit of a reputation for being a little seedy, it was not as bad as we thought it would be. There are the regular winos but they are harmless, and the side that the Rimini is on we felt was more secure than the opposite side (the southern side). We felt that the service was pretty good all round. One day the staff let us use the iron and later they came back and ironed some of our clothes to give us a hand. Whilst this was not expected of the staff it did demonstrate the above average service they provide to the guests. Overall, as per the title, we'd definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Hotel Rimini”
Reviews.Author: cam1965
Reviews.Content: We stayed on the Rimini late June 2006 and we were very impressed. Location from the station is excellant as we made our way around Rome Via Buses and undergroud. The room we had was exceptional, spar in the bathroom very large with picture window elcove, which we stored all our luggage in. Reception staff and breaky room staff very friendly. You must try the cute little restaurant they recommend a little old italian couple cook and run it and it's great! I am a Travel Agent and will be recommending as I have before that my clients that are on a budget stay at HOTEL RIMINI.

Reviews.Title: “TUTTO BENISSIMO!!!”
Reviews.Author: manowar
Reviews.Content: We were advised by QANTAS to stay here because the rooms were "larger" than typical Roman hotels in this class. You would therefore understand our astonishment when the manager offered for us to stay in the "family suite" down the block AT NO EXTRA COST. We were only a party of three - so we didn't expect this!!) Although one short block away from the hotel itself, the apartment is only 2 minutes walk away. It is on the top floor of an apartment building, and is accessed by the world's smallest elevator (note for other reviewers: it's even smaller than the one in the hotel building!!) The apartment features two VERY large bedrooms - each with two double beds, independent A/C, and televisions. It also features a kitchen and gas cooker, all cuttlery and chinaware, laundry, ensuite, and a foyer. It is also VERY secure, with a triple bolted vault door. The apartment is serviced every day, and the cleaning lady will also do your washing for you (an extraordinary level of service in anyone's books). There is no telephone in the apartment, so it is probably not ideal for business travellers - but for families, I cannot speak highly enough. The only minor point to be aware of is that the shower is tiny - I mean REALLY tiny, and water pressure is low - but these are minor when considered in context!! Breakfast is very good, and if you are out touring before it is served at 6:30 am, then the hotel staff will gladly provide you with a snack or packed lunch on request. Whilst staff may not appear too personable, they are very efficient and get the job done. The cleaning lady also works the breakfast room - she is quite the character! Location is ideal, as it is immediately next door to Termini Station. This was especially good for us as we arrived on the Leonardo Express from the airport. It is also superb for anyone wanting to use the supermarkets, or the subways or buses to get around. There are also a few good Italian restaurants nearby. Overall, our stay was very memorable. A 5 star hotel could not have matched the quality of room and service we received. An important tip for families of three or more: ask your agent to book the private apartment - truly amazing stuff!!! Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Quite Acceptable.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Location: Fantastic, next to the Railway Station (200mts max) and walking distance from all famous sites Staff: Very cooperative in stay and helpful with road directions and sight seeing tips. Spoke just about enough English. Rooms: Our quad room was good with attached shower and WC that was very clean and conveniently planned out. More than one could use the washroom at a time that was very good for our family. Rooms were cleaned everyday and linen changed too. Only drawback was No View, one window facing the inner courtyard that was not at all attractive. Hotel Ambience: Registered as 4 star but definitely not one. Situated in a building and sharing space with another hotel. Looked more like a private lodging. With only a small reception and two chairs in the so called lobby. Breakfast: Ok. Other Convenience: Next door is an internet and telephone shop that is very cheap and very efficient. Overall: Acceptable. Except for the hotel ambience and standard. Not good for day time stay but fantastic for business or sleep at night sort of trip. Might go back.

HotelInfo.Name: Rimini Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Via Marghera 17, 00185 Rome, Italy
